Desc.entry: Service for people using adult mental health services in Sheffield. Helps users to have a say on issues and decisions that may affect them, talks through concerns and helps users to plan. Supports people in being informed about their situation, the choices available and more aware of how to exercise their rights. Gives assistance at meetings and appointments. Provides access to specialist legal advice and representation, and assists with complaints. Home visits available if required. Also offers a new Independent Mental Health Advocacy (IMHA) service. An IMHA is a specialist type of mental health advocate. IMHA services provide an additional safeguard for patients who are subject to the Mental Health Act. IMHAs are trained to work within the framework of the Act. They will help qualifying patients to understand the legal provisions to which they are subject under the Mental Health Act 1983 and the rights and safeguards to which they are entitled. Self or any referral.
